title: Ticket #3064: debug_wait should be volatile
description:
/src/condor_daemon_core.V6/daemon_core_main.cpp around line 2044: 
                    int debug_wait = 1;
                    dprintf(D_ALWAYS,
                                    "%s is TRUE, waiting for debugger to attach to pid %d.\n",
                                    debug_wait_param.Value(), (int)::getpid());
                    while (debug_wait) {
                            sleep(1);
                    }

The compiler is free to optimize debug_wait out, meaning you can't just "set debug_wait=0" because debug_wait no longer exists. Fix should be as simple as declaring it volatile.

This functionality, exposed via <SUBSYS>_DEBUG_WAIT is undocumented and intended only for internal use. Thus, this change shouldn't be documented.

Workaround (for anyone using the old code): If you're using gdb, try "jump daemon_core_main.cpp:2046". However, this doesn't reliably work.
